recipes.title: Chicken Jambalaya
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A quick Cajun-style one-pot meal with chicken, rice, tomatoes, and vegetables.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook celery, onion, and green pepper in margarine or butter till vegetables are tender.
Stir in the undrained tomatoes, chicken broth, rice, basil or thyme, garlic salt, pepper, hot pepper sauce, and bay leaf.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 20 minutes or till rice is tender.
Stir in chicken; cook till heated through. Discard bay leaf. Makes 4 servings.

notes: FAST recipe tag in cookbook

recipes.title: Chicken-Cheese Crepes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant crepes filled with chicken, peas, carrots, and a creamy cheese sauce.

ingredients.item: shredded process Swiss, Gruyere, or American cheese

instructions.text: Prepare Crepes. Cook frozen peas and carrots according to package directions. Drain and season to taste with salt and pepper; set aside.

For sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion and green pepper in margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk and broth all at once. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Stir in cheese; sherry, if desired; parsley; and hot pepper sauce. Remove 1 cup of the sauce; set aside.

Drain mushrooms; stir into remaining sauce. For filling, combine cooked peas and carrots, the 1 cup sauce, and chicken or turkey. Spread 1/4 cup filling over the unbrowned side of each crepe, leaving a 1/4-inch rim around edge. Roll up crepes.

Place, seam side down, in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Cover; bake in a 375° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till heated through. Reheat remaining sauce; drizzle some over crepes. Pass remaining sauce. Makes 6 servings.

notes: Microwave directions available in original

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Chicken Divan
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic casserole with chicken and broccoli in a creamy cheese sauce, topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: Cook broccoli according to package directions; drain. Arrange in a 10x6x2-inch baking dish.

Meanwhile, for sauce, in a medium saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in flour, pepper, and nutmeg. Add cream or milk and chicken broth all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add Swiss cheese and wine, stirring till cheese melts.
Pour half of the sauce over broccoli. Top with chicken or turkey, then the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and paprika.
Bake in a 350° oven about 20 minutes or till heated through. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Microwave directions available in original

recipes.title: Chicken-Asparagus Stacks
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: English muffins topped with asparagus, chicken, and a creamy yogurt sauce.

instructions.text: Cook asparagus or broccoli according to package directions. Drain; keep warm.

In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till onion is tender. Stir in condensed soup and yogurt till smooth. Stir in chicken. Heat through. If desired, stir in almonds. Top rusks or muffin halves with the asparagus or broccoli, chicken mixture, and egg slices. Makes 4 servings.

notes: FAST recipe tag in cookbook
Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Chicken Submarines
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty submarine sandwiches filled with chicken, avocado, and a creamy yogurt dressing.

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream, plain yogurt, mayonnaise, or salad dressing

ingredients.prep_note: small, halved, seed removed, peeled, and thinly sliced
American, Swiss, cheddar, or Monterey Jack

instructions.text: In a bowl mix 1/2 cup dairy sour cream, plain yogurt, mayonnaise, or salad dressing; 2 teaspoons prepared mustard; 1/2 teaspoon dried basil, crushed; and 1/8 teaspoon garlic powder.
Halve, seed, peel, and thinly slice 1 small avocado. If desired, brush avocado with lemon juice.
Split 4 individual French rolls and scoop out some of the center of each half. Spread both halves of rolls with some of the yogurt mixture.

On the bottom half of each roll, layer 1 leaf lettuce; 2 slices cooked chicken or turkey; 1 slice American, Swiss, cheddar, or Monterey Jack cheese; 3 thin slices tomato or 6 thin slices cucumber; and the avocado slices. If desired, top with alfalfa sprouts. Replace roll tops. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Glazed Chicken and Vegetables
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Roasted chicken with potatoes, carrots, and apples in a honey-mustard glaze.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and quartered, or 6 new potatoes

instructions.text: Rinse chicken and pat dry. Skewer neck skin to back. Tie legs to tail. Twist wing tips under back. Place, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Brush with oil. Roast chicken, uncovered, in a 375° oven for 1 hour.
Cook potatoes and carrots in boiling water for 20 to 25 minutes or till nearly tender. Drain.
For glaze, in a saucepan combine honey, mustard, margarine, onion, curry powder, garlic salt, red pepper, and ginger. Bring to boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heat; set aside.

Discard fat in roasting pan. Cut apples into wedges. Arrange potatoes, carrots, and apples around chicken in the pan. Spoon glaze over poultry, vegetables, and apples. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes more or till chicken is no longer pink, the drumsticks move easily in their sockets, and the vegetables are tender. Makes 6 servings.

notes: Microwave directions available in original

recipes.title: Roast Herb Chicken
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Roasted chicken brushed with a tangy herb-lemon mixture.

ingredients.item: dried tarragon, oregano, basil, thyme, savory, or sage

instructions.text: Rinse chicken and pat dry. Skewer neck skin to back; tie legs to tail. Twist wings under back.
Place, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Melt margarine or butter; stir in lemon juice and a herb or garlic. Brush over chicken.

Roast, uncovered, in a 375° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours or till no longer pink and the drumsticks move easily in their sockets, brushing occasionally with drippings. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Honey and Spice Duckling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Roasted duck with a sweet and spicy Szechwan pepper glaze.

ingredients.prep_note: coarsely ground, or 1 teaspoon whole pepper, coarsely ground

instructions.text: Rinse duck; pat dry. In a bowl combine pepper, salt, ginger, and five-spice powder. Sprinkle body cavity of duck with some of the salt mixture; rub remaining mixture on skin of duck. Skewer neck skin to back; tie legs to tail. Twist wing tips under back. Prick skin all over with a fork.

Place duckling, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Roast in a 375° oven for 1 3/4 to 2 1/4 hours or till the drumsticks move easily in their sockets and duck is no longer pink, spooning off fat occasionally. Meanwhile, mix honey and soy sauce; baste duck with honey mixture once or twice during the last 10 minutes of roasting. Makes 3 or 4 servings.

recipes.title: Stuffed Cornish Game Hens
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant individual game hens stuffed with a savory bread stuffing and glazed with orange sauce.

instructions.text: Cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon; drain and crumble. Cook carrot in drippings over medium heat till tender; remove from heat. Stir in bacon, parsley, savory, and pepper. Stir in bread cubes.
Dissolve the 1/4 teaspoon bouillon granules in 2 tablespoons hot water. Drizzle over bread mixture, tossing lightly.

Rinse hens; pat dry. Season cavities with salt. Lightly stuff hens with bread mixture. Pull neck skin, if present, to back of each hen. Twist wing tips under back, holding skin in place. Tie legs to tail.
Place hens, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Brush with oil; cover loosely with foil. Roast in a 375° oven for 30 minutes.

Stir together wine, melted margarine or butter, and the 2 tablespoons orange juice; brush on hens. Roast hens, uncovered, about 1 hour more or till tender and no longer pink, brushing with wine mixture twice.

For sauce, add additional orange juice to remaining wine mixture to make 3/4 cup. In a small saucepan combine cornstarch, brown sugar, and the 1/2 teaspoon bouillon granules. Stir in wine mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Serve sauce with hens. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Bacon and Double Cheese Quiche
recipes.attribution: Great American Home Baking
recipes.description: Paired with a tossed green salad, this full-flavored quiche makes an excellent lunch.

ingredients.item: chilled butter, cut into small pieces

instructions.text: To prepare the crust, in a large bowl, mix together the flour and salt. Using a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut in the butter until coarse crumbs form.
Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with a fork, until dough forms. Shape into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375°F. On a lightly floured surface, using a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough into 11-inch circle. Fit into 9-inch pie pan. Trim edge, leaving 1/2-inch overhang. Fold under to form standup edge. Prick dough with a fork. Line with foil and fill with pie weights or dried beans.
Bake for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and weights. Bake until golden, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.
Meanwhile, prepare filling. In a medium skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel to drain.

In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, thyme, and pepper. Pour into crust. Crumble bacon. Sprinkle the egg mixture with the bacon, Gruyere cheese, and Cheddar cheese. Bake until golden and custard is set, about 30 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: To freeze: Cool baked quiche completely, wrap airtight, and freeze for up to 1 month.

recipes.title: Italian Sausage Sandwiches
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a skillet cook sausage till no pink remains. Drain fat. Stir in pizza sauce and mushrooms. Top bottom halves of rolls and mushrooms. Spoon meat mixture on top. Place pepper rings on top. Place sandwich halves on a shallow baking pan or on a 375° oven for 5 minutes. Top with cheese. Bake about 3 minutes more or till cheese melts. Cover with roll tops. If desired, serve with pepperoncini.

Microwave directions: In a 1½-quart casserole cook sausage, covered, on 100% power (high) for 4 to 6 minutes or till no pink remains, stirring twice. Drain. Stir in pizza sauce and mushrooms. Micro-cook, uncovered, on high for 2 to 3 minutes or till heated through. Assemble and bake sandwiches as above.

missing_inputs: Not in database: mushroom stems and pieces, drained

recipes.title: Bacon and Onion Bratwursts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: medium onions, sliced and separated into rings
fully cooked bratwursts or knackwurst, or 4 frankfurters

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook bacon till crisp. Drain bacon, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Crumble bacon and set aside.
In same skillet with reserved drippings, cook onions and green pepper over medium heat about 5 minutes or till onion is tender but not brown. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 tablespoon mustard.
Meanwhile, in another skillet cook bratwursts, knackwurst, or frankfurters in a small amount of water about 5 minutes. Drain.
Place sausages in buns. Top with onion mixture. Sprinkle with bacon. Pass additional Dijon-style mustard.

missing_inputs: Not in database: fully cooked bratwursts or knackwurst, or 4 frankfurters

recipes.title: Apple-Stuffed Sausage Patties
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Combine sausage and beef; shape into ten ¼-inch-thick patties.
In saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine till tender but not brown. Remove from heat. Add apple juice or water. Remove from heat. Stir in stuffing mix.

Add apple, mustard, and pepper. Place about ¼ cup stuffing atop each of five patties. Top with remaining patties. Press edges to seal. Place on a rack in a shallow baking dish or pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till no pink remains. Makes 5 servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.5 for finely chopped celery (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for finely chopped peeled apple

recipes.title: Liver and Onions
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: beef liver, cut into serving-size pieces

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook onion in margarine till tender. Remove from skillet. Add more margarine if necessary.

Add liver to skillet. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Turn liver. Return onion to skillet. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or till liver is slightly pink in center. Pour lemon juice over. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Create-Your-Own Meat Loaf
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Customize your meat loaf with your choice of meat, bread, liquid, vegetable, and seasonings.

ingredients.item: soft bread crumbs (1 slice) or dry bread crumbs, or quick-cooking oats
tomato juice, beef broth, apple juice, or water
finely chopped onion, celery, carrot, or green pepper
dried thyme, basil, oregano, or sage, crushed (optional)

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, tomato juice or other liquid, onion or other vegetable, parsley, salt, herb (if desired), and pepper.

Add ground meat; mix well. Shape into a 2-inch-circle ring with a 2-inch diameter hole in the center, or form into a 7½x3-inch loaf, or pat mixture into a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan or divide into a 7½x3½-inch loaf pan.

Bake in a 350° oven for 45 to 50 minutes for the ring (25 to 30 minutes for the loaf or loaf pan) or till no pink remains. Transfer to a serving plate. Spoon sauce over meat, if desired; Makes 6 servings.

Microwave directions: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, onion, celery, and parsley, if desired. Add ground meat and mix well. Shape into a 2-inch-circle ring with a 6-inch diameter hole in center. Place ring in a 9-inch pie plate. Cover with waxed paper. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 8 to 10 minutes or till no pink remains, giving the dish a quarter-turn every 3 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate.

notes: Ham Loaf: Prepare as above, except use soft bread crumbs. Substitute dry mustard for the herb and omit salt. Reduce ground beef or lamb to ½ pound and add ½ pound ground ham. Bake 50 minutes or till juices run clear.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, cream or milk, the bread crumbs, onion, parsley, salt, and allspice or nutmeg. Add the beef and pork; mix well. Shape into 30 meatballs. In a large skillet cook meatballs, half at a time, over medium heat about 10 minutes or till no pink remains, turning to brown on all sides (shake skillet or turn meatballs once to prevent sticking).
Remove meatballs from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Repeat with remaining meatballs.

Stir flour into reserved drippings. Add bouillon granules and 1¼ cups water. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add meatballs to sauce. Cook on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring twice.
Serve over noodles. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

notes: Microwave directions: In a mixing bowl combine egg, ¼ cup of the milk, the bread crumbs, onion, parsley, the ¼ teaspoon salt, and allspice or nutmeg. Add beef and pork; mix well. Shape into 30 meatballs. In a dish or plate microwave-safe, place meatballs on 100% power (high), covered with waxed paper, on 100% power (high) for 3½ to 5½ minutes or till no pink remains, rearranging once. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Repeat with remaining meatballs in 2-quart casserole. Cook and stir flour into remaining milk, bouillon granules and 1 cup water. Micro-cook, uncovered, on high for 6 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Add meatballs. Micro-cook, covered, on high for 1 minute more. Serve with noodles.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for light cream or milk (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for soft bread crumbs
Assumed 1 unit for ground allspice or nutmeg

recipes.title: Spaghetti Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a Dutch oven cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, basil, oregano, tomato paste, 1 teaspoon salt, and bay leaf. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf.
Serve sauce over spaghetti. If desired, pass grated Parmesan cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Microwave directions: Makes 6 servings. In a 3-quart casserole combine meat, onion, mushrooms, and garlic on 100% power (high) 6 to 8 minutes, stirring twice. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients except spaghetti. Micro-cook, covered, on high for 15 minutes more or till slightly thickened, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf. Serve over spaghetti.

notes: Spaghetti and Meatballs: Prepare as above, except omit ground meat. Prepare Swedish Meatballs (see recipe, page 241), but do not serve on noodles. Cook ½ pound bulk Italian sausage, onion, mushrooms in a large skillet. Drain. Add meatballs to sauce. Heat through. Serve over spaghetti. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for chopped green pepper (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for dried oregano, crushed

recipes.title: Porcupine Meatballs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The rice pokes out like a porcupine's quills.

instructions.text: Combine egg, ¼ cup of the soup, uncooked rice, onion, salt, and Worcestershire. Add beef; mix well. Shape into 20 meatballs. Place in a large skillet.

Combine remaining soup with ½ cup water. Pour over meatballs. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 35 to 40 minutes or till rice is tender. Stir in peas, if desired. Simmer 5 minutes more. Serves 4 or 5.

Microwave directions: Combine egg, ¼ cup of the soup, uncooked rice, onion, salt, and Worcestershire. Add beef; mix well. Shape into 20 meatballs. In an 8x8x2-inch baking dish micro-cook meatballs, covered, on 100% power (high) for 6 minutes, rearranging once. Drain. Pour over sauce. Micro-cook meatballs, covered, on high for 3 to 5 minutes more or till rice is tender.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for long grain rice
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Hamburgers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: ground beef, veal, or ground lamb

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg and milk. Stir in bread crumbs, onion, mustard or horseradish, salt, and pepper. Add meat; mix well.

Form mixture into four ¾-inch-thick patties (10 to 12 minutes for 15 to 18 patties). Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat for 10 to 12 minutes for 15 to 18 patties. Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat of broiler. Turn once. Serve on buns. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Cheeseburgers: Prepare as above, except place sliced American, cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Swiss cheese on patties at end of cooking time. Broil about 1 minute or till cheese begins to melt.
Italian-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute grated Parmesan cheese for the milk. Stir in 2 tablespoons snipped parsley and 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning with the bread crumbs.

Mexican-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute salsa or taco sauce for the milk and mustard. Stir in 2 tablespoons chopped canned green chili peppers and 1 teaspoon chili powder with the bread crumbs. Serve with additional salsa or taco sauce, if desired.

Greek-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute plain yogurt for the milk and ¼ teaspoon cracked wheat or ¼ cup dried oregano, crushed, for the bread crumbs. Stir in ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon with the bread crumbs. If desired, serve with additional plain yogurt and 1 tablespoon curry powder with the bread crumbs.
Indian-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except substitute plain yogurt for milk and omit mustard. Stir in 2 tablespoons chopped chutney and 1 tablespoon curry powder with the bread crumbs.
German-Style Burgers: Prepare as above, except stir in 2 tablespoons drained sauerkraut, chopped, and 1 teaspoon caraway seed with the bread crumbs. Serve with mustard.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Strata
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a greased 8x8x2-inch baking dish layer 8 bread-slice halves, the cheese slices, then the remaining bread-slice halves. Beat eggs; stir in milk, onion, mustard, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ⅛ teaspoon pepper. Pour over bread and cheese layers. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover; chill in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours.
Bake, uncovered, in a 325° oven for 45 to 50 minutes or till set and lightly browned. Let stand 10 minutes. Serves 6.

notes: Vegetable Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup chopped cooked broccoli or carrot atop cheese slices.
Meat Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup diced fully cooked ham or 1 cup diced cooked chicken or turkey atop cheese slices. (If using ham, omit salt.)

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese-Stuffed Manicotti
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Cook manicotti according to package directions (or see chart, page 278); drain. For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts.

In a bowl stir together egg, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, parsley, peel, and nutmeg. Fill manicotti with ricotta mixture. Arrange in a 12x7½x2-inch baking dish. Pour sauce over filled shells. Cover and bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till hot. Serves 4.

Microwave directions: Cook manicotti as above. For sauce, in a 4-cup measure combine onion, garlic, and margarine. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 1½ to 2½ minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour. Add 1 cup milk. Stir. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts. Fill manicotti as above. Pour sauce atop. Cook, covered with vented clear plastic wrap, on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till heated through, turning dish once.

notes: Spinach Manicotti: Prepare as above, except reduce ricotta to ½ cup. Omit mozzarella and parsley. Add ½ cup crumbled feta cheese and one 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, to ricotta mixture.

Creamy Lasagna: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 lasagna noodles for the manicotti. Spread ¼ cup ricotta mixture over each cooked lasagna noodle. Roll up noodles and place, seam side down, in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Stuffed Burgers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Burgers stuffed with olives, vegetables, or cheese for extra flavor.

ingredients.item: stuffed olives, pimiento-stuffed green olives, or shredded zucchini, carrots, or cheese

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, and basil. Add meat and mix well. Shape meat mixture into eight thin patties about 4 inches in diameter.
Top each of four patties with olives, vegetables, or cheese. Spread to within 1/2 inch of edges. Top with remaining patties. Press edges to seal.
Place patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat for 15 to 18 minutes or till no pink remains, turning once. Serve on buns. Makes 4 servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Garden Burgers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: parsley or zucchini, flawed or shredded

instructions.text: Combine egg, catsup, bread crumbs, carrot, onion salt, and pepper. Stir in vegetables. Add meat; mix well. Shape meat mixture into four 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Place patties on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat for 15 to 18 minutes, turning once. Brush with catsup before serving. Serve on lettuce. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Tacos
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: canned green chili peppers, seeded and chopped

instructions.text: Heat taco shells according to package directions.

For filling, in a large skillet cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown and onion is tender. Drain fat. Stir in tomatoes and chili peppers. Heat through. Fill each taco shell with meat mixture. Top with lettuce and cheese. If desired, serve with taco sauce. Makes 12 tacos.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Sloppy Joes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: ground beef, ground pork, or ground raw turkey

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook meat, onion, celery, and green pepper till meat is brown. Drain fat.
Stir in catsup, water, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, chili powder, and hot pepper sauce. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or till mixture is of desired consistency.
Serve on buns. Makes 6 servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Lasagna
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For cheesy, vegetarian lasagna, see page 159.

ingredients.item: ground beef, ground pork, or bulk Italian sausage

instructions.text: For meat sauce, in a large saucepan cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown and onion is tender. Drain fat. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, basil, oregano, fennel, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
For filling, combine egg, ricotta or cottage cheese, Parmesan or Romano, and parsley. Drain. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain.
Layer half of the cooked noodles in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Spread with half of the filling. Top with half of the meat sauce and half of the mozzarella cheese.
Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan cheese atop. Bake in a 375° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till heated through. Let stand 10 minutes. Serves 8.

notes: To make ahead: Prepare as above, except after assembling, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate up to 24 hours. Remove plastic wrap and cover with foil. Bake in a 375° oven for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake about 20 minutes more or till heated through.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fettuccine with Cheese Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Rich pasta dish with creamy cheese sauce

instructions.text: Cook fettuccine or noodles according to package directions. Drain; keep warm.
For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings in pan. Crumble bacon and set aside.
Cook mushrooms, green onion, and garlic in reserved drippings till tender but not brown.
Stir in butter or margarine till melted.
Stir in flour, salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Add cheese; stir till melted.
Stir in bacon and parsley.
Serve cheese sauce over hot fettuccine. If desired, sprinkle with freshly ground pepper.

notes: Can substitute butter for bacon drippings if desired

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Crab Mornay
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant crab dish in creamy cheese sauce

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook mushrooms, onion in butter or margarine till tender. Stir in flour.
Add milk all at once; cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Add Swiss cheese and crabmeat; stir till cheese melts. Stir in parsley, wine, and red pepper.
Serve over patty shells or toast points. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.

notes: Shrimp Mornay: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 ounces cooked, peeled, and deveined shrimp or two 4-1/2-ounce cans shrimp
Lobster Mornay: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 cup cooked lobster or one 6-1/2-ounce can lobster, drained, broken into large pieces, and cartilage removed, for crabmeat

recipes.title: Deviled Crab
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic deviled crab baked in shells or ramekins

instructions.text: In a saucepan melt the 2 tablespoons margarine. Stir in flour. Add milk and hot pepper sauce all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in crabmeat, chopped egg, cheese, pimiento, and mustard. Spoon into four 10-ounce casseroles or coquille shells.
Toss bread crumbs with the 1 tablespoon melted margarine; sprinkle over casseroles. Top with almonds.
Bake at 375° oven about 20 minutes or till tops brown.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for dry bread crumbs

recipes.title: Crab Cakes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan-fried crab cakes

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl combine crabmeat, mayonnaise, egg, bread crumbs, green onion, Worcestershire, dry mustard, and red pepper.
Stir to mix well. Form into 6 patties about 3 inches in diameter.
In a large skillet heat about 3 tablespoons oil. Add half of crab cakes. Cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or till golden brown. Remove; keep warm.
Repeat with remaining crab cakes, adding more oil if necessary.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for ground red pepper (standard quantity)
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Shrimp Creole
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Louisiana-style shrimp in spicy tomato sauce served over rice

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet cook onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in butter, margarine, or olive oil till tender but not brown.
Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato sauce, bay leaf, sugar, salt, paprika, red pepper, and parsley. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.
Stir together cornstarch and cold water; add to tomato mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Add shrimp; return to boiling. Cover and simmer for 1 to 3 minutes more or till shrimp turn pink.
Discard bay leaf. Serve over hot cooked rice.

notes: Fish Creole: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh fish fillets for shrimp. Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fillets into 1-inch pieces. Add fish to the tomato mixture. Cover and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or till fish flakes with a fork.

recipes.title: Shrimp Chow Mein
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Stir-fried shrimp with vegetables in Asian-style sauce

ingredients.item: chow mein noodles or hot cooked rice

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Cut any large shrimp in half lengthwise. For sauce, combine water, soy sauce, cornstarch, bouillon granules, and ginger.
Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat; add cooking oil.
Stir-fry mushrooms, onion, and garlic for 1 minute. Remove. Stir-fry vegetables. Stir-fry shrimp for 2 to 3 minutes or till shrimp turn pink.
Push to side of wok. Stir sauce; add to center of wok. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add water chestnuts, bean sprouts, pea pods, and cooked vegetables. Stir-fry through.
Serve over chow mein noodles or hot cooked rice.

notes: Scallop Chow Mein: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen scallops for the shrimp. Thaw scallops if frozen. Cut any large scallops into bite-size pieces. Stir-fry scallops for 2 to 3 minutes or till they turn opaque.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for chow mein noodles or hot cooked rice
Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Shrimp in Garlic Butter
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Quick sautéed shrimp in garlic butter sauce

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet heat margarine or butter over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp and garlic; cook, stirring for 3 to 5 minutes or till shrimp turn pink.
Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

notes: Scallops in Garlic Butter: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces scallops for the shrimp. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes or till scallops turn opaque.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: French-Fried Shrimp
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic crispy fried shrimp with instructions for butterflying

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Peel shrimp, leaving last section before the tails and the tails intact. To devein shrimp, use a sharp knife to make a shallow slit along the back of shrimp. Remove the sandy black vein, if present.

To butterfly the shrimp, make a deeper slit along the back of the shrimp, cutting almost all the way through the shrimp on a flat surface so that the sides open to resemble a butterfly. Rinse; pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.
In a large deep saucepan or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches melted shortening or oil to 375°.
Meanwhile, for batter, stir together flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt, and dash pepper. Make a well with the dry ingredients. Beat egg slightly.
Combine egg, cold water, and the 2 tablespoons oil; add to dry ingredients. Beat with a rotary beater till smooth.
Dip shrimp in batter. Fry a few at a time in hot oil for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remainder.
Serve with Cocktail Sauce, if desired.

notes: How to devein a shrimp: use the tip of a knife to lift out the black vein
To butterfly the shrimp: make a deep cut down the back. Do not cut all the way through

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)
Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cheese Strata
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Layered bread and cheese casserole, perfect for brunch

instructions.text: In a greased 8x8x2-inch baking dish layer 8 bread-slice halves, the cheese slices, then the remaining bread-slice halves.
Beat eggs; stir in milk, onion, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Pour over bread and cheese layers. Sprinkle with paprika.
Cover; chill in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours.
Bake, uncovered, in a 325° oven for 45 to 50 minutes or till set and lightly browned. Let stand 10 minutes.

notes: Vegetable Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup chopped cooked broccoli or carrot atop cheese slices
Meat Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup diced fully cooked ham or 1 cup diced cooked chicken or turkey atop cheese slices. (If using ham, omit salt.)

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese-Stuffed Manicotti
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pasta shells stuffed with a rich cheese mixture

instructions.text: Cook manicotti according to package directions (see chart, page 278); drain.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts.
In a bowl stir together egg, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, parsley, peel, and nutmeg. Fill manicotti with ricotta mixture.
Arrange in 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish. Pour sauce over filled shells. Cover and bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till hot.

notes: Microwave directions: Cook manicotti as above. For sauce, in a 4-cup measure combine onion, garlic, and margarine. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 1-1/2 to 2-1/2 minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour. Add 1 cup milk. Stir. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts. Fill manicotti as above. Pour sauce atop. Cook, covered with vented clear plastic wrap, on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till heated through, turning dish once.

Spinach Manicotti: Prepare as above, except reduce ricotta to 1/2 cup. Omit mozzarella and parsley. Add 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese and one 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, to ricotta mixture.

Creamy Lasagna: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 lasagna noodles for the manicotti. Spread 1/4 cup ricotta mixture over each cooked lasagna noodle. Roll up noodles and place, seam side down, in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Meatless Red Beans and Rice
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Adjust the amount of ground red pepper to give this dish the zing you like

ingredients.item: dry red beans or dry red kidney beans

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a large saucepan combine beans and 3 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 1 hour. (Or, soak by placing beans and 3 cups water in a bowl. Cover and set in a cool place for 6 to 8 hours or overnight.)
Drain beans in a colander and rinse. Return beans to the saucepan. Stir in onion, garlic, bay leaf, salt, fennel seed, red pepper, and 3 cups fresh water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer about 2-1/2 hours or till beans are tender, adding more water, if necessary, and stirring occasionally.
Uncover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes more or till a thick gravy forms. Discard bay leaf. Serve over rice.

notes: Meaty Red Beans and Rice: Prepare as above, except omit salt and fennel seed. Add 1/2 pound smoked pork hocks or meaty ham bone with onion. When beans are tender, remove hocks or ham bone. Cut meat from bones or bone. Discard bones or bone and return meat to bean mixture along with 1/2 pound smoked sausage, cut into bite-size pieces.
Red Beans and Corn Bread: Prepare as above, except omit rice and spoon bean mixture over squares of corn bread.

recipes.title: Cider-Caraway Pot Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tender pot roast with apple cider and caraway seeds

instructions.text: Trim fat from roast. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a Dutch oven brown roast on all sides in hot oil. Drain. Add onions, apple cider, carrot, caraway seed, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer for 1-1/2 hours or till tender.
Transfer meat to a serving platter; keep warm. Skim fat from pan juices. Measure juices; add water if necessary to equal 1-1/2 cups.
Combine sour cream and cornstarch. Stir into pan juices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Pass with meat.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Horseradish-Rubbed Beef Rib Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Prime rib roast with horseradish crust

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or whipping cream

instructions.text: For gravy, skim fat from pan juices. Measure juices. Combine sour cream with equal amount of pan juices. Stir in horseradish. Cook and stir till thickened.
Citrus-Ginger Pot Roast: Prepare as above, except omit caraway seed. Stir into gravy 6 to 8 strips orange peel and 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger for the horseradish mixture.

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Standing Rib Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic prime rib roast with Yorkshire Pudding

ingredients.item: Oven-Browned Potatoes, Yorkshire Pudding, or Beef au Jus

instructions.text: Place meat, fat side up, in a 15x10x2-inch roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer.
Roast in a 325° oven for 1-3/4 to 3-1/4 hours for rare (140°), 2-1/4 to 3-3/4 hours for medium (160°), or 2-1/2 to 4-1/4 hours for well-done (170°).
Prepare Oven-Browned Potatoes, Yorkshire Pudding, or Beef au Jus. Remove meat from pan. Cover with foil and let stand 15 minutes before carving.

notes: For perfect accompaniments to roast beef, make Oven-Browned Potatoes, Yorkshire Pudding, or Beef au Jus

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Oven-Browned Potatoes, Yorkshire Pudding, or Beef au Jus (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Beef Pot Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic braised beef pot roast with vegetables

instructions.text: Trim fat from roast. In a Dutch oven brown roast on all sides in hot oil. Drain. Combine Worcestershire sauce, bouillon granules, and basil. Pour over roast.
Add 1/2 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Add onions, carrots, and celery. Cover and simmer for 45 to 60 minutes more or till meat and vegetables are tender.
Remove meat and vegetables; keep warm. Pour pan juices into measuring cup. Skim fat. Add water to equal 1-1/2 cups.
For gravy, return liquid to pan. Combine 1/4 cup cold water and flour. Stir into pan. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Season to taste.

notes: Microwave directions: Trim fat from roast. In a 3-quart casserole combine water, Worcestershire sauce, bouillon granules, and basil. Add roast. Micro-cook, covered, on 100% power (high) for 5 minutes. Cook, covered, on 50% power (medium) for 25 to 40 minutes. Turn roast over. Add vegetables. Cook, covered, on medium for 25 to 40 minutes more or till tender, adding water if necessary. Remove meat and vegetables.
Crockery-cooker directions: Trim the fat from roast and brown as above. Season to taste. Cook on low-heat setting for 8 to 10 hours. Add vegetables during the last 4 hours.
Barbecue-Style Pot Roast: Prepare as above, except omit Worcestershire sauce and basil. Combine 1 cup barbecue sauce, 1 tablespoon dry mustard, and 1 tablespoon chili powder. Pour over meat.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Beef Wellington
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant beef tenderloin wrapped in puff pastry with liver pâté

ingredients.item: liver pâté or canned liver pâté

instructions.text: If roast is long and narrow, fold narrow ends under and tie. If roast is flat and wide, tie crosswise in 2 or 3 places to form a round, thick roast. (Final meat should be about 7x3x3 inches.) Remove from oven.
Wrap in foil in a shallow pan. Roast in a 425° oven about 25 minutes or till rare (120°). Remove from oven.

Meanwhile, for pastry, combine flour and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cut in shortening till pieces are the size of small peas. Combine egg yolks and water. Add to flour mixture, tossing with a fork till all is moistened. Form into a ball.

On floured surface, roll pastry into a 14x12-inch rectangle. Spread pâté to within 1-1/2 inches of edges. Center meat atop pastry. Wrap pastry around meat. Trim excess pastry from ends; fold up and seal. Brush with beaten egg white.
Place seam side down. Bake in a golden brown, Serve with Bordelaise Sauce.
Bake in a 425° oven about 25 minutes or till pastry is golden. Serve with Bordelaise Sauce.

notes: Bordelaise Sauce: In a saucepan combine 1-1/2 cups beef broth, 1/2 cup dry red wine, 2 tablespoons finely chopped shallot or onion, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 bay leaf, and 1 teaspoon instant beef bouillon granules. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Stir together 3 tablespoons softened margarine and 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour; stir into broth. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Stir in 1 tablespoon snipped parsley.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Vegetable-Stuffed Rolled Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Beef eye round roast stuffed with vegetables

instructions.text: To butterfly the roast, make a single lengthwise cut down the center of the meat, cutting to within 1/2 inch of the other side. Spread the meat open.

At the center of the roast, make one perpendicular slit to the right of the V and one perpendicular slit to the left. Cover roast with clear plastic wrap. Pound with a meat mallet to 1/2 to 3/4-inch thick.

Cook bacon till crisp. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Crumble bacon; set aside. Cook onion, carrot, garlic, and basil in reserved drippings over medium heat till tender. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon.
Spread bacon mixture over roast. Roll up from one of the short sides. Tie with string to secure. Place meat on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer.
Roast in a 325° oven for 1-1/4 to 1-3/4 hours or till meat thermometer registers 140°. Cover with foil and let stand for 15 minutes before carving. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

recipes.title: New England Boiled Dinner
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic corned beef and cabbage - Serve on Saint Patrick's Day or as a great way to prepare corned beef brisket

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. Place in a Dutch oven; add juices and spices from package of corned beef. Add enough water to cover meat. Add peppers and bay leaves.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 2 to 2-1/2 hours or till almost tender.
Add carrots, parsnips, potatoes, and onion. Return to boiling. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add cabbage; heat. Cover; cook for 15 to 20 minutes more or till tender. Discard bay leaves.
Serve meat and vegetables. If desired, serve with mustard. Prepare as above, except omit potatoes; serve the corned beef and vegetables on cabbage.

notes: Dutch oven directions: Trim fat from roast. Cover with water in a 3-1/2- or above 4-quart crockery cooker. Cook on low heat setting for 10 to 12 hours. Add vegetables during the last 1 to 1-1/2 hours.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Herbed Rump Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Braised beef rump roast with herbs

instructions.text: Trim fat from roast. In a Dutch oven brown roast in hot oil. Drain fat. Combine onion, bouillon granules, marjoram, thyme, bay leaf, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Add to roast.
Add 1 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer till tender.
Remove bay leaf. Stir together 1/4 cup cold water and flour. Stir into pan juices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in parsley.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Zesty Short Ribs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Braised beef short ribs with tangy sauce

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. Place in a Dutch oven. Add water to cover meat. Cover and simmer about 1-1/2 hours or till tender.
For sauce, combine catsup, molasses, lemon juice, and mustard. Drain meat.
Boil meat fat side up on rack of a broiler pan. Brush with sauce on the unheated rack for 10 to 15 minutes, brushing with sauce. Brush often and brushing with sauce.

Grill directions: Prepare meat and prepare sauce as above. In a covered grill arrange medium-hot coals around a drip pan. Test for slow heat above coals. Place ribs on grill rack over drip pan but not over coals. Brush with sauce. Lower grill hood. Grill 20 to 25 minutes, turning and brushing occasionally with the sauce. Heat remaining sauce; pass with ribs.

recipes.title: Five-Spice Beef Ribs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Asian-inspired beef short ribs with five-spice powder

instructions.text: Place ribs in a plastic bag set into a deep bowl.
For marinade, combine soy sauce, sherry, garlic, orange juice, gingerroot, cinnamon, aniseed, and pepper. Pour over ribs. Close bag.
Marinate in refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours, turning bag occasionally.
Remove meat from bag, reserving marinade. Trim fat from meat.

Grill directions: In a covered grill arrange medium-hot coals around a drip pan. Test for slow heat. Place ribs bone side down on grill rack over drip pan. Brush with marinade. Cover; grill 1-1/2 to 2 hours or till tender, brushing with marinade. Bake, covered, in a 350° oven for 1-1/4 to 2-1/4 hours. Bake as above.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Lemon-Marinated Chuck Steak
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tender chuck steak marinated in lemon and Worcestershire sauce

instructions.text: Slash fat on edges of roast. Place meat in a plastic bag set into a shallow dish.
For marinade, combine lemon peel, lemon juice, cooking oil, onion, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Pour over meat. Close bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours, turning bag occasionally.

recipes.title: Swiss Steak
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic braised beef steak with tomatoes

instructions.text: Cut meat into 4 serving-size pieces.
Combine flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. With a meat mallet, pound flour mixture into meat.

In a large skillet brown meat on both sides in hot oil. Drain fat. Add undrained tomatoes, onion, celery, carrot, and thyme. Cover; cook over low heat about 1-1/4 hours or till meat is tender. Skim fat. Serve with hot rice or noodles.

Crockery-cooker directions: Cut meat into 4 pieces. Brown meat in hot oil in a 3-1/2- or 4-quart electric slow cooker. Sprinkle with thyme, 2 tablespoons quick-cooking tapioca, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add tomatoes over vegetables. Pour undrained tomatoes over all. Cover; cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours. Oven directions: Cut meat into 4 pieces. Transfer meat to an 8x8x2-inch baking dish. In the same skillet combine undrained tomatoes, onion, celery, carrot, and thyme. Bring to boiling; scraping up any browned bits in the pan. Pour over meat. Cover and bake in a 350° oven about 1 hour or till tender. Continue as above.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Steak and Spinach Pinwheels
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant beef pinwheels stuffed with spinach and bacon

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook bacon till just done but not crisp. Drain on paper towels. Score steak by making shallow diagonal cuts at 1-inch intervals in a diamond pattern. Repeat on second side. With a meat mallet, pound steak into a 12x8-inch rectangle, working from center.
To edges: Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange bacon lengthwise on steak. Spread spinach on bacon. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Roll up from a short side. Secure with wooden picks at 1-inch intervals, starting 1/2 inch from one end. Cut between picks into eight 1-inch slices.

Place cut side down on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from the heat for 6 minutes. Turn; broil for 6 to 8 minutes more for medium doneness. Remove picks. If desired, serve with Mock Hollandaise Sauce.
Grill directions: Prepare meat as above. Grill slices on an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 6 minutes, allowing 6 to 8 minutes per side for medium. Serve as above.

notes: Score the steak by making shallow diagonal cuts about 1 inch apart in a diamond pattern
Using a sharp knife, cut the meat roll between the picks into eight 1-inch slices

missing_inputs: Not in database: Mock Hollandaise Sauce

recipes.title: London Broil
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic flank steak broiled and sliced thin

instructions.text: Score meat by making shallow diagonal cuts at 1-inch intervals in a diamond pattern on both sides.
Place meat in a plastic bag. For marinade, combine oil, vinegar, and garlic; pour over meat. Marinate at room temperature for 1 hour or in refrigerator for 4 to 24 hours.
Remove meat from marinade. Pat dry. Place on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat for 6 minutes. Turn; broil 5 to 6 minutes more for medium doneness.
To serve, thinly slice diagonally across the grain.

recipes.title: Pepper-Rubbed Steaks
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Steaks with cracked pepper crust and brandy cream sauce

ingredients.item: beef top loin or tenderloin steaks

instructions.text: Slash fat on edges of steaks at 1-inch intervals. Sprinkle pepper onto surface of steaks. In a 12-inch skillet melt margarine. Cook steaks over medium-high heat for 7 to 9 minutes for medium-rare, turning once. Remove meat. Gradually reduce heat.

Stir in brandy, stirring to scrape up crusty browned bits. Stir cream into skillet. Cook for 1 minute on low heat. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer for 1-1/2 to 2-1/2 minutes or till slightly thickened. Pour over steaks. Serves 4.

recipes.title: French Onion Sandwiches
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Open-faced steak sandwiches with melted Swiss cheese

instructions.text: In a large skillet melt margarine. Add steaks and garlic. Cook over high heat for 2 to 3 minutes.
Place steak slices on French bread. Sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Broil 3 inches from heat till cheese melts. Serves 4.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for London Broil steak slices (standard quantity)
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Veal Cordon Bleu
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic veal cutlets stuffed with ham and Swiss cheese

instructions.text: Cut ham into strips. Cut veal into 4 pieces. With a meat mallet, pound each piece to 1/4-inch thickness. Place some ham in center of each veal piece, then overlap each piece with wooden picks.

Combine bread crumbs, parsley, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Roll meat bundles in flour, egg, then crumb mixture. In a large skillet melt margarine. Cook meat bundles over medium heat for 14 to 17 minutes or till golden brown, turning occasionally.

Oven directions: Prepare meat bundles as above. In a large skillet brown meat bundles in melted margarine for 5 minutes. Transfer to a 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish. Bake in a 400° oven for 18 to 20 minutes or till done.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Veal Marsala
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Italian veal cutlets with Marsala wine sauce

ingredients.item: boneless veal leg top round steak

instructions.text: Cut veal into 4 pieces. With a meat mallet, pound each piece to 1/4-inch thickness. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper.

In a large skillet cook mushrooms in 1 tablespoon of the margarine till tender; keep warm on each side of the veal over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the veal over medium heat for 2 minutes on each side. Remove veal; keep warm.
Add remaining margarine, sherry, and bouillon granules to skillet. Bring to boiling. Cook, stirring rapidly, for 3 minutes. Stir in parsley.
Pour over veal. If desired, serve with hot cooked noodles.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Beef Fajitas
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Serve the most sizzling hot for a typical South Texas flair

ingredients.item: boneless beef plate skirt steak, beef flank steak, or beef round steak

ingredients.prep_note: (see recipe, page 13) or dairy sour cream (optional)

ingredients.item: Shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips. Place strips in a plastic bag set into a deep bowl. For marinade, in a mixing bowl combine the 1/2 cup Salsa, the lime juice, and Worcestershire sauce. Pour mixture over beef. Seal bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally.

Wrap tortillas in foil. Meanwhile, in a 350° oven for 10 minutes to soften. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add oil. Cook and stir onion and sweet pepper strips in hot oil for 1-1/2 minutes. Add beef, cook and stir about 1-1/2 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove vegetables from skillet.
Add half of the beef to the hot skillet. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till done. Remove beef. Repeat with remaining beef and vegetables to the hot skillet. Add 1/2 cup Salsa; heat through.
To serve, immediately fill warm tortillas with beef-vegetable mixture. If desired, add Guacamole or avocado dip, sour cream, cheese, and additional Salsa. Roll up fajitas. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Marinating the Easy Way: Marinating is a cinch if you use a plastic bag. The meat stays in the marinade and it's easy to turn and rearrange. Cleanup is easy, too. Just toss the bag.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Russian-inspired beef in sour cream sauce

ingredients.item: beef tenderloin steak or sirloin steak

instructions.text: Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips. Combine flour and sour cream; set aside.

In a large skillet cook mushrooms in 1 tablespoon of the margarine till tender. Remove mushrooms. Add remaining margarine. Add half of the beef to hot skillet. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till done. Remove beef. Repeat with remaining beef.
Add 3/4 cup water and bouillon granules to skillet. Stir in sour cream mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Return beef and mushrooms to skillet. Heat through. Serve over hot cooked noodles. Serves 4.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for hot cooked noodles

recipes.title: Beef Teriyaki Kabobs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Grilled beef kabobs with teriyaki marinade

instructions.text: Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into long strips. For marinade, combine soy sauce, sherry, molasses, applesauce, gingerroot, and garlic. Pour over meat.
Marinate for 15 minutes at room temperature. Or, 8 hours in refrigerator, reserving marinade.
Drain meat, reserving marinade. Thread accordion-style on skewers.
Place skewers on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from the heat for 5 to 6 minutes or to desired doneness, turning and brushing occasionally with marinade.
Grill directions: Cut, marinate, and skewer meat as above. Place on uncovered grill directly over hot coals 5 to 6 minutes, turning and brush with marinade often.

recipes.title: Ginger-Beef Stir-Fry
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Quick Asian-style beef stir-fry with ginger

ingredients.item: beef top round steak or sirloin steak

instructions.text: Thaw pea pods. Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips. For sauce, combine sherry, soy sauce, cornstarch, and gingerroot.
In a wok or large skillet stir-fry carrots and garlic in hot oil for 2 minutes. Add broccoli; stir-fry 2 minutes more.
Add pea pods and bamboo shoots; stir-fry about 1 minute or till vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove vegetables from wok.
Add half of the beef to the wok. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till done. Remove beef. Repeat with remaining beef.

Add 1/2 cup water or beef broth to center of wok. Stir sauce; add to center of wok. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Return beef and vegetables to wok; stir to coat. Heat through.
If desired, serve with hot cooked rice. Serves 4.

notes: Stir-Frying Hints: There's no mystery to stir-frying if you follow these hints:
- Use a spatula or a long-handled spoon to gently lift and turn the food with a folding motion so it won't burn.
- Use high heat, but keep the food moving so it won't burn.
- If you need to add more oil during cooking, bring it to frying temperature before adding more food.

recipes.title: Spinach-Stuffed Lamb Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Boneless leg of lamb stuffed with spinach and feta cheese

instructions.text: For stuffing, in a small saucepan cook onion and celery in margarine till tender. Cool. Stir in spinach, feta cheese, and oregano.
Remove fell (paper-thin, pinkish red layer) from lamb, if present. Cut pockets in lamb and fill with garlic slivers.
Spread stuffed surface of meat with spinach mixture. Roll up from a long side. Tie securely. Add 1/4 cup water. Place, seam side down, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan.
Roast in a 325° oven for 1-1/2 to 3 hours or till meat thermometer registers 150°. Let stand 15 minutes before carving. Makes 12 to 15 servings.

notes: To carve a leg of lamb, cut 3 slices from the thin side parallel to the bone. Rest the leg on its base.

recipes.title: Herb-Rubbed Leg of Lamb
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic roasted leg of lamb with herbs

instructions.text: Remove fell from lamb. Cut small slits in lamb; insert garlic slivers.
Combine lemon juice, parsley, mint, onion salt, rosemary, and pepper. Rub over lamb.
Place lamb, fat side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 1-3/4 to 2-1/4 hours or till thermometer registers 150°.
Let stand 15 minutes before carving. If desired, garnish with fresh mint. Serve with mint jelly. Makes 12 to 16 servings.

notes: Beginning at the wide end, cut 1/4-inch slices down to leg bone. Cut along bone to free slices.

recipes.title: Currant-Glazed Rack of Lamb
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant rack of lamb with currant glaze

ingredients.item: tarragon or wine or apple juice

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. Place roast, rib side down, in a shallow roasting pan. Roast in a 325° oven. With a small saucepan combine jelly, wine, and tarragon. Heat till smooth. Brush roast with glaze.
Roast for 1 to 1-1/4 hours for medium (160°), brushing occasionally with glaze.
Mini-Glazed Rack of Lamb: Prepare as above, except use mint jelly for currant jelly.

recipes.title: Curried Lamb
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Lamb stew with curry and apples

instructions.text: In a large saucepan brown half of the meat in hot oil. Remove meat. Brown remaining meat with onion, curry powder, and garlic till onion is tender. Return all meat to pan.
Stir in flour. Add 3/4 cup water. Stir in bouillon granules and apples. Cook for 30 minutes or till thickened. Stir in raisins. Cook 5 more minutes.

Microwave directions: Omit cooking oil. In a 2-quart casserole micro-cook lamb, onion, curry, and garlic, covered, on 100% power (high) 5 minutes, stirring once. Drain. Stir in flour. Add 3/4 cup water and bouillon. Cook, covered, on 50% power (medium) for 9 to 11 minutes or till tender, stirring every 5 minutes. Stir in apples, covered, on high 3 to 5 minutes more. Stir into casserole. Cook, covered, on 50% power (medium) 5 minutes; stir every minute. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute.
Serve over hot cooked rice.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for hot cooked rice

recipes.title: Vegetable-Lamb Skillet
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Italian-style lamb with vegetables and beans

ingredients.item: frozen Italian-style green beans or frozen green beans

instructions.text: Run cold water over beans to separate; set aside.
Trim fat from meat. In a large skillet brown chops and onion in hot oil. Drain fat.
Combine 3/4 cup water, bouillon granules, pepper, oregano, and basil. Pour over chops. Add beans and potatoes.
Cover; cook for 20 to 25 minutes or till tender. Remove meat and vegetables. Skim fat from juices. Cook juices, uncovered, for 3 to 4 minutes.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for pitted ripe olives

recipes.title: Saucy Lamb Shanks
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Braised lamb shanks with vegetables

instructions.text: Cut 3-1/2 to 4 pounds lamb shanks (4) into 1-rib portions. In a 12-inch skillet brown shanks or ribs in 1 tablespoon hot cooking oil. Drain fat.
Combine 1 cup finely chopped carrot, 1 cup finely chopped celery, 1/4 cup dry red wine, and 2 cloves garlic, minced.
Add to skillet. Cover; simmer for 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours or till tender. Remove shanks or ribs. Cover; keep warm.
For sauce, skim fat from pan juices. Add water to equal 1 cup. Return to skillet. Add 1 can (8 oz) tomato sauce, 1 bay leaf.
For sauce, boil pan juices rapidly for 6 to 8 minutes. (You should have about 3 cups.) Discard bay leaf. Serve sauce over shanks and hot cooked noodles. Makes 4 servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Lamb Chops with Herb Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Quick lamb chops with sour cream herb sauce

ingredients.item: lamb shoulder chops or sirloin chops

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. In a large skillet brown chops with salt and pepper in hot cooking oil.
Add 3/4 cup water, celery, bouillon granules, and thyme. Cover; simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or till tender. Remove meat; set aside.
For sauce, combine sour cream or yogurt and flour; stir into pan juices. Cook and stir over medium-high heat till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute.

For sauce, reserve 1/2 cup juices; set aside. Skim fat from reserved juices. Cook cream or yogurt, flour, thyme or diluted mushrooms. Cook on high for 3 to 4 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Pass sauce with lamb chops.

notes: Microwave directions: Trim fat from meat. In a 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish, micro-cook lamb chops, covered with vented clear plastic wrap, on 100% power (high), for 3 minutes. Turn chops. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and micro-cook, on high for 4 to 6 minutes more or till chops are done. Reserve 1/2 cup juices. Skim fat.

recipes.title: Lamb Chops with Honey-Mustard Glaze
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Broiled lamb chops with sweet and tangy glaze

instructions.text: Trim fat from lamb chops. Place chops on unheated rack of broiler pan.
Broil 3 inches from heat for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine honey, mustard, and lemon juice. Turn chops; brush with honey mixture. Broil for 5 to 7 minutes more or till desired doneness, brushing once with remaining honey mixture.
Grill directions: Prepare meat and honey mixture as above. Grill chops on uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 10 to 14 minutes, turning once. Continue as above.

recipes.title: Lamb Shish Kabobs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Middle Eastern lamb kabobs

instructions.text: Partially freeze lamb. Cut into 3-inch-long strips about 1/4 inch thick. For marinade, in a bowl combine 1/4 cup lemon juice, oil, garlic powder, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add lamb; stir to coat.
Marinate in refrigerator for 4 to 24 hours.
Drain meat, reserving marinade. On four long skewers, alternately thread meat accordion-style, zucchini, and mushrooms. Add cherry tomatoes to each skewer.
Place on unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from heat for 6 to 8 minutes for medium, turning and brushing skewers often. Add 2 cherry tomatoes or cherry tomatoes to each skewer.

Grill directions: Prepare meat and marinade as above. In covered grill, arrange medium-hot coals around a drip pan. Test for medium heat. Place kabobs on grill rack over pan. Cover; grill for 6 to 8 minutes for medium, turning and brushing with marinade.

recipes.title: Creole Stuffed Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Boneless pork roast with flavorful Creole stuffing.

instructions.text: For stuffing, in saucepan cook celery, onion, and garlic in butter until tender but not brown.
Add bread cubes, parsley, thyme, and hot pepper sauce. Toss to mix, adding enough broth to moisten.
Cut a lengthwise slit in the roast, cutting to but not through opposite side. Spread open.
Spoon stuffing into opening. Tie roast securely with string at 1-inch intervals.
Place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Insert meat thermometer.
Roast uncovered at 325°F for 1¾ to 2¼ hours or until thermometer registers 160°F.
Let stand 15 minutes before carving.

notes: Internal temperature should reach 160°F

recipes.title: Rib Crown Roast of Pork
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant crown roast of pork formed from the rib section, perfect for special occasions.

instructions.text: Season roast with salt and pepper. Place bone ends up in shallow roasting pan.
Wrap tips of bones with foil to prevent burning.
Insert meat thermometer into thickest portion, not touching bone.
Roast uncovered at 325°F for 2½ to 3 hours or until thermometer registers 160°F.
Transfer to warm platter. Remove foil from bone tips. If desired, place paper frills on bones.
Fill center with hot cooked vegetables or stuffing if desired.

notes: Allow 1 to 1¼ ribs per serving
Ask butcher to tie roast into crown shape
Can fill center with your favorite stuffing or vegetables

recipes.title: Harvest Pot Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tender pork roast braised with vegetables for a hearty one-pot meal.

instructions.text: In Dutch oven brown roast on all sides in hot oil. Drain off fat.
Add cider, onion, celery, salt, caraway seed, and pepper.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 1¼ hours.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cover and cook 30 minutes more.
Add cabbage wedges. Cook 15 to 20 minutes more or until meat and vegetables are tender.
Transfer meat and vegetables to platter. Skim fat from juices; pass with meat.

notes: Apple cider adds subtle sweetness to the braising liquid

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Roast Pork with Mushroom-Butter Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pork roast served with a rich mushroom butter sauce.

ingredients.item: dry white wine or chicken broth

instructions.text: Season roast with salt and pepper. Place on rack in shallow roasting pan.
Insert meat thermometer. Roast uncovered at 325°F for 1¾ to 2¼ hours or until thermometer registers 160°F.
For sauce, in skillet cook mushrooms and green onions in butter until tender.
Add wine. Bring to boiling; reduce slightly.
Slice roast and serve with mushroom sauce.

notes: Sauce can be made while roast rests after cooking

recipes.title: Pork with Apple-Nutmeg Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pork tenderloin served with a sweet apple and nutmeg sauce.

instructions.text: In large skillet cook pork slices in butter over medium-high heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Remove and keep warm.
Add apple juice to skillet, scraping up browned bits.
Stir in applesauce, brown sugar, and nutmeg.
Cook and stir until slightly thickened. Serve sauce over pork.

notes: The sauce can be made thicker by cooking longer

recipes.title: Citrus-Glazed Pork Ribs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tender pork ribs with a tangy citrus glaze.

ingredients.item: pork loin back ribs or spareribs

instructions.text: Cut ribs into serving-size pieces. Place ribs, bone side down, in shallow roasting pan.
Roast uncovered at 350°F for 1 hour. Drain off fat.
Meanwhile, combine marmalade, lemon juice, soy sauce, and ginger.
Brush ribs generously with glaze. Roast 30 minutes more, brushing occasionally with glaze.

notes: Ribs can also be finished on the grill for a smoky flavor

recipes.title: Barbecue-Style Ribs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic oven-baked ribs with homemade barbecue sauce.

ingredients.item: pork loin back ribs or spareribs

instructions.text: Cut ribs into serving-size pieces. Place ribs, bone side down, in large shallow roasting pan.
Roast uncovered at 350°F for 1 hour. Drain off fat.
Meanwhile, in saucepan combine remaining ingredients. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes.
Brush ribs with sauce. Roast 45 minutes to 1 hour more, brushing with sauce every 15 minutes.

notes: Reserve some sauce for serving at the table

recipes.title: Braised Steaks Italian
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pork steaks braised in a savory Italian tomato sauce.

instructions.text: In large skillet brown steaks on both sides in hot oil. Drain off fat.
Combine tomato sauce, water, onion, green pepper, Italian seasoning, salt, and garlic.
Pour over steaks in skillet.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 45 to 60 minutes or until meat is tender.
Serve steaks with sauce.

notes: Serve over hot cooked pasta or rice

recipes.title: Linguine with White Clam Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Italian pasta with a garlicky white wine clam sauce.

instructions.text: Cook linguine according to package directions, reserving liquid from clams.
Measure liquid; add enough light cream or milk to make 1½ cups total. Set aside.
In saucepan cook garlic in butter till tender. Add clams, reserved liquid mixture, oregano, salt, pepper.
Cook and stir till thickened. Add clams and parsley. Heat through.
Serve sauce over linguine. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

notes: Can substitute canned clams for fresh

recipes.title: Linguine with Red Clam Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pasta with a tomato-based clam sauce seasoned with oregano and wine.

instructions.text: Cook linguine according to package directions. Drain clams, reserving liquid.
In saucepan combine reserved clam liquid, tomato sauce, wine, onion, parsley, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 15 minutes.
Stir in clams; heat through. Serve over linguine. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Coquilles Saint Jacques
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic French scallops in a creamy wine sauce, baked in shells.

instructions.text: Thaw scallops if frozen. Halve any large scallops.
In skillet cook scallops in 2 tablespoons butter for 1 to 3 minutes or till scallops turn opaque. Drain; remove scallops with a slotted spoon. Set aside.
In same skillet cook mushrooms and onion in remaining 1 tablespoon butter till tender.
Stir in flour. Add milk and wine. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Add cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Stir in scallops. Spoon into 4 coquille shells or gratin dishes.
Combine bread crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over scallop mixture.
Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes or till heated. Sprinkle with parsley.

notes: Can be prepared ahead and refrigerated before baking

recipes.title: Curried Scallop Kabobs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Grilled scallops with curry-spiced marinade.

instructions.text: Thaw scallops if frozen. On 8 skewers thread scallops, tomato wedges, and pepper pieces alternately.
Combine oil, lemon juice, curry powder, and garlic. Brush over kabobs.
Place on ungreased rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat for 8 to 10 minutes, turning once and brushing often with curry mixture.

notes: Can also be grilled over medium-hot coals

recipes.title: Crawfish Étouffée
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Louisiana smothered crawfish in a rich seasoned sauce, served over rice.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and deveined shrimp may substitute

ingredients.item: crawfish fat, cooking oil, or margarine

instructions.text: Thaw crawfish tails or shrimp if frozen. In a large skillet cook onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in butter till tender.
Add crawfish. Add tomato sauce, cornstarch, red pepper, and 3/4 teaspoon black pepper.
Cook crawfish for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring. Return to boiling. Simmer, uncovered, for 4 to 5 minutes or till crawfish are tender (shrimp turn pink).
Season to taste. Serve with rice.

notes: Traditional Louisiana Cajun dish
Shrimp may be substituted for crawfish

recipes.title: Fried Seafood
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Crispy battered and fried clams, oysters, or shrimp.

ingredients.item: shucked clams or oysters, or shrimp

instructions.text: Pat seafood dry with paper towels.
Coat with flour, dip in beaten eggs, then roll in crushed crackers.
Fry a few at a time in deep hot fat (375°F) for 1 to 2 minutes or till golden.
Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in 300°F oven while frying remainder. Serve with tartar sauce if desired.

notes: Do not crowd fryer
Serve immediately for best crispness

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Oysters au Gratin
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Baked oysters with mushrooms in a creamy wine sauce topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: Pat oysters dry. In a large skillet cook mushrooms and garlic in 1 tablespoon butter till tender.
Stir in flour. Add milk, wine, and Worcestershire sauce. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Add oysters. Spoon into 4 individual au gratin dishes or casseroles.
Combine bread crumbs, Parmesan, and melted butter. Sprinkle over oyster mixture.
Bake at 400°F oven for 10 minutes or till crumbs are brown.

recipes.title: Citrus-Ginger Pot Roast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Asian-inspired pot roast with orange and ginger flavors.

instructions.text: Trim fat from roast. In a Dutch oven brown roast on all sides in hot oil. Drain fat.
